location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 154 from William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a communication sent by Mountstuart Elphinstone, Governor of Bombay to Rahma bin Jabir [Raḥmah bin Jābir], Shaikh of the Jalahamah tribe, dated 16 January 1826, in response to a letter received from him, dated 7 November 1825. The enclosure is in Arabic and includes a translation in English.The enclosed letter explains that the British interfered with his conflict with the people of Quteef [Al-Qaṭīf] because he had targeted the boats of neutral tribes, and thus threatened the stability of trade in the region. It further urges him not to renew a system of piracy in the Persian Gulf.
